alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 6:28PM EDT until July 24 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of NORTHWEST Kentucky, including the following county, Hancock. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hawesville, Chambers, Goering, Arrington Corner, Weberstown, Floral, Dukes, Patesville, Pellville and Sunny Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
